summary:
-|- a German native and a Dutch lawyer, a bilingual and bicultural lawyer, providing legal translation services, operating within a network of lawyers, business experts and language professionals, providing specialist translations for lawyers and businesses -|-  

As a lawyer-linguist and experienced legal translator I have abundant translation and proofreading experience in the fields of corporate law, commercial and business law, trade law, contractual law, law of inheritance, property law, tax law, litigation law, criminal law and criminal policy.

In the wake of the inevitable alteration of the linguist profession as a result of a rapidly increasing artificial intelligence, i.e. neural machine translation, I furthermore consider myself a professional in automatic translation issues, an expert in machine translation matters in other words, and a specialist in the post-editing of various textual and genre types, mainly, but not only legal, 
 
A personal development which has benefited from the fact that due to mere personal reasons, I have been conducting correspondence in a language I am not familiar with on a daily basis for years. 

This means that dealing with this particular kind of artificial intelligence clearly has become second nature to me.

Written communication in a language you do not speak is not possible - never has been possible - you might think. 

But, you are wrong - it is possible! And finding out procedural details is exactly what is meant by becoming a specialist in machine translation issues. The procedure is neither cryptic nor difficile, but requires a routine: 

autotranslating - retranslating - analysing - adapting - re-autotretranslating - reanalysing - re-adapting.

Another long-term interest of mine has been in collecting web resources which are not only useful for qualified legal and financial translators but basically for anybody interested in languages and multilingualism, contributing to the assumption that the Internet is more than a commercial platform. 

Indeed, it is not just enthusiasm, or even altruism whereupon I base my trilingual collection of such web resources, which almost invariably requires a great deal of commitment and effort to generate and to maintain. 

Rather, it is curiosity about how the emerging Semantic Web really works out, especially in the context of search engine Google. 

So to say, I do not just have a collection of web resources in various language versions, neither a common translation and localisation conceptualisation, but an interconnection of independent ideas in pursuing a theme.

projects.title: Post Editing Machine Translation (Juristisches PEMT)
projects.description:
Aufgrund der mehrjährigen täglichen Nutzung maschineller Übersetzungen zur Kommunikation privater Art erachte ich mich als sachkundig und erfahren den innovativen Bereich der maschinellen Übersetzung betreffend, nämlich im Hinblick auf das sog. Pre-Editing der für automatisches Übersetzen angereichter juristischer Texte und - mehr noch - das Post-Editing automatisch übersetzter Rechtstexte.  

Was beinhaltet diese Sachkunde, Erfahrung, ja Expertise auf dem Gebiet der maschinellen Übersetzung?

Sie beinhaltet das routinierte Durchlaufen eines mehrstufigen Verfahrens: 

Zunächst die Eingabe eines deutschen Textes unter Beachtung gewisser Parameter: einfache Sätze, prägnante Wortwahl, vorsichtiger Umgang mit Idiomatik, besonders Metaphern gilt es zu meiden! 

Dann die automatische Übersetzung dieses deutschen Textes in die mir nicht geläufige Fremdsprache der Kommunikation. 

Im nächsten Schritt die Rückübersetzung ins Deutsche und die Analyse des Ergebnisses dieser Rückübersetzung. 

Im Weiteren ein analytisches Schlussfolgern und eine den Erkenntnissen der Analyse entsprechende Anpassung des deutschen Ausgangstextes, erforderlichenfalls unter Rückgriff auf eine Onlinesuche einzelner Wendungen des fremdsprachlichen Textes in Textkorpora. 

Sodann ein erneutes Übersetzen des entsprechend angepassten deutschen Ausgangstextes in die mir nicht geläufige Fremdsprache, zwecks Abgleich, d.h. Vergewisserung semantischer, grammatischer, syntaktischer und idiomatischer Stimmigkeit. 

Ein Verfahren, das zwischen Sprachen mit grundlegenden strukturellen Übereinkünften (indoeuropäische Sprachen) überraschend gut funktioniert, so man denn in der Anwendung geübt ist.

Mit anderen Worten: Insofern man weiß wie, ist man Anfang des dritten Jahrzehnts des einundzwanzigsten Jahrhunderts in der Lage, (nahezu) fehlerfreie Texte in Fremdsprachen zu schreiben, die man selbst gar nicht spricht, geschweige denn versteht, sondern bestenfalls beim Lesen ein wenig zu durchgründen in der Lage ist.

projects.title: Book translation
projects.description:
In the past 20 years I have translated countless legal and financial texts of various volume. Moreover, I have been frequently engaged as a (legal) copy editor.  [The "five Cs" summarize the copy editor's job, which is to make the copy "clear, correct, concise, coherent and consistent."]

The most challenging translation project, however, I found myself engaged with was a book translation (Flemish into German):

- Criminaliteit en rechtshandhaving in de Euregio Maas-Rijn
- Kriminalität und Strafverfolgung in der Euregio Maas-Rhein

by Dirk Van Daele and Bart Vangeebergen - 983 pages in the original, that equals 958 pages in the translation - addressing the common police, judicial and criminal policy among the Federal Republic of Germany, the Kingdom of the Netherlands and the Kingdom of Belgium in the so called Meuse-Rhine Euregio, reflecting the investigatory powers and cooperation between the competent national authorities in the respective countries.

profile_positions.description:
‘The law is constituted in terms of language and cannot subsist without it. The understanding about what is lawful and what is law is bound to the medium of language. It forms the very basis. Without it, law cannot come into being, be interpreted and be acknowledged'.

Eulenhaupt Translation Services is a group of experienced lawyer-linguists providing expert legal translation, financial translation and legal translation editing, which means review of legal text and revision of legal translation.

What exactly is a lawyer-linguist?

A lawyer-linguist, or jurilinguist, is a law graduate in the capacity of a legal language expert, thus a specialist in translating and revising 'law' texts of any kinds and types.

Why should I choose a lawyer-linguist instead of a legal translator when I am in need of a legal text translation into a foreign language or a verification and thus revision of a legal document translated from a foreign language?

Because the former, unlike the latter, is able to solve subtle translational challenges in such a way that a coherent, consistent and precise rendition of the source text can be guaranteed. 

And, why should I engage Eulenhaupt Lawyer-Linguists’ Services to do my legal translation or the verification and thus revision of my legal translation?

Because as a network of qualified legal language experts (legal translation specialists and legal editing professionals) we offer linguistic support, more detailed:

– translation services by lawyers, economics (for lawyers and businesses).
– review and proofreading (for lawyers and businesses)
– (post-) editing services by lawyers (to lawyers and businesses).

Routine and polished fluency in both the source and target language is to be combined with expertise in the conventions and divergences arising from disparate legal frameworks.

As bilingual and bicultural lawyers, we see or at least can reflect substantive and procedural commonalities and differences in Civil law and Common law systems.
